fields.description: Since we are using multiple sprints (one is one-week and the other is two week long) with one product backlog, we are constantly facing a problem that start and end dates of sprints are changing randomly, so our burndown charts don't show the actual data. We have to edit sprints start and end dates every day to keep the charts updated.
fields.summary: sprints start and end dates are changing randomly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With  the introduction of the [The new Jira issue view | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] on both the Full screen pop up and Side bar view on a Board, the text and comment fields have inconsistent behavior to the same fields on the main jira issue view, noting:
{quote}
The editor in the new issue view uses markdown rather than wiki markup. Right now, if you've added wiki markup in the old editor, we'll render it correctly in the new issue view.

As we continue to roll out the new issue view and new editor, wiki markup support will be phased out and eventually removed in favor of markdown.
{quote}

In the New Views Wiki markup does not work and only the Rich Text Editor (RTE) options are available with markdown, where editing the same fields from the direct issue view both wiki markup and RTE options are available, leaving an inconsistent experience

h3. Suggested Solution
Both options have benefits, Using wiki markup in Text View is extremely useful for power users comfortable with the formatting, allowing for faster on the fly edits, where RTE allows for WISIWIG layout for visual inspection prior to posting,  Support for Markup and markdown rather than phasing out markup in favor of markdown similar to current field behavior would be appreciated.
 
h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Inconsistent UI behavior in Text Fields regarding wiki markup

fields.description:
As Jira User I have found a bug that Configure Field "Automated?" should have Radio Button rather than Check box.

Because it can be a boolean value either it can be a "Yes" or "No" but it CAN'T be both.

I am able to check both the boxes Automated? => "yes" and "NO"
fields.summary: Configure Field "Automated?" is having Check box rather than Radio Button

fields.description:
Hello,

 

Do you have a solution to perform "versionning, release" on components? In our case the components can be linked to requests and different versions.

This is very important for our working method

Sofian
fields.summary: VERSIONNING - RELEASE COMPONENTS
As a Jira Software user, I want the Version Report to consider issues of a 'sub-task type'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Commits are not being displayed on the issues' developmnet panel and smart commits are not working for Github integration.
The commits are not shown on the Development Panel and if a comment is added to the commit message, this comment is not added to the issue. If the workflow has a transition with a trigger, the transition works as expected.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud integrated with Github

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Perform a commit with a message. e.g.: KEY-1 # comment test

h3. Expected Results
Commands added to the commit message are performed and the commit is shown on the Development Panel

h3. Actual Results
The commit is not listed on the Development Panel and the commands on commit message fail
 
h3. Notes
* 

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Commits are not visible on development panel and smart commits are not working for Github integration

fields.description:
Hello,

When managing a huge amount of tickets and tracking time in Estimation and Remaining, using a comma is not quite practical.

Could you offer the possibility to use a dot instead, as there's a dot on the numeric keypad and this is quite easier to use (as in MS Excel for example) than the comma ?

Thanks a lot.

Have a nice day,
fields.summary: Ability to use "." when tracking time

fields.description:
*Request:*

It would be useful if users can create new Jira issues via the Link Modal and link them right away to an existing issue when accessing Issue Details > Links. Please see below screenshot.

Currently, a user can link to existing issues by typing the issue key or searching for the issue. Common user scenarios,
 * Splitting the existing issue into multiple issues during an active sprint
 * Creating related tasks and test cases linked to the original issue

!image-2018-07-10-19-25-03-001.png!
fields.summary: Ability to link existing JIRA issue to a new jira issue (create new) via the Link Modal

fields.description:
Please add an option to play a video that was added to an issue.

Right now I am able to add a video to an issue but to see the content of it you have to download it (moreover that is assuming the other user have a player on his computer).

 P.S
The videos that I'm adding to issues are screen records, with the ending of .webm

Thank you for your time reading my suggestion.
fields.summary: Video player

fields.description:
When I submit time log of previous work on task but in front side show same date time log 
Example : I summite time log of date of 3 July 2018 but after submission its how only 4 July 2018 and when i try to edit it then its show 3 july 2018
fields.summary: Time log Not change

fields.description:
[Reproduce video|https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zHGYUj1552_y_5oguOVNpy38udNi1Vcb/view]

1) Attach a file to a ticket

2) Click to that attach

3) Click to a shadow overlay or on a close button

4) UI hangs and freeze, get errors in the browser JS console "Maximum call stack size exceeded"
fields.summary: JS Error: "Maximum call stack size exceeded" when clicking on attachment overlay

fields.description:
When viewing issues with a "fix version(s)" set, the version will show similarly to a label in the backlog view. The issue is that the display is set to be viewed in all capital letters even when the version is using camel casing or other casing to improve the readability.

Because of the change of case, the readability of the version is negatively impacted.

I would like to suggest preserving the casing when displaying the names in the backlog view.
fields.summary: Show fix versions in backlog view as proper case

fields.description:
Using Portfolio, you can't link 'epic' to a parent issue using the parent link from the New Issue View.
Not only when creating a new epic in Portfolio' but we can't see the filed 'parent link' in the new view/edit Jira ticket screen

"Old View" with access to the edit issue screen and the parent link field:
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-03 at 16.54.35.png|thumbnail! 
"New View", no edit screen's link or access to the parent link field:
 !Screen Shot 2018-07-03 at 16.54.07.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Portfolio's users can't see the 'parent link' in the new JIRA issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
I would like to set my board to show issues in the columns based on labels or other fields instead of status which is the default option. That will help me to monitor my issues from a different perspective.

h3. Suggested Solutions 
Create a different board type from Kanban/Scrum where we can customize the board columns.
fields.summary: As a project manager, I want to be able to customize the information related to columns on my board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you create a branch from Jira and choose an origin branch different then *Master*, Bitbucket will set *Master* as the origin anyway.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # With a Bitbucket account already set on Jira. Navigate to an issue.
 # Click on *Create branch*.
 # Select a different branch from _Master_ as the origin.
 # Set the new branch name.
 # Click on *Create branch*
 # *Master* will be set as the origin branch.

h3. Expected Results

The branch you select will be the origin of your new branch.
h3. Actual Results

The origin is always *Master*: check [this video|https://cl.ly/3D1k3h1u1l06].
h3. Solution / Workaround

Create a branch directly from Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Create branch from issue development panel is not working properly.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the German language in JIRA, the *days is column* in kanban board is not showing the remaining days
h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a kanban board
# Switch the language to German in General Configuration of JIRA

h3. Expected Results
The correct value of remaining days should be shown
h3. Actual Results
Only the Text *in dieser Spalte* is being shown
 

h3.Workaround
Switch to English language in JIRA
fields.summary: Kanban board "days in column" not working in German language

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Agility projects, when starting sprints using the mobile app for Jira, the 'Board' page for that board, which displays the currently active sprint, breaks when opened in desktop browsers. This happens because the GOAL is set as null in the database, which is not correctly handled by the JavaScript handling the board.

Apparently, this is only breaking Agility projects, as regular projects can handle null GOALs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility project
# Enable sprints
# Create a sprint
# Open Jira in a mobile app and start the sprint there
# Open board in web version (desktop browser)

h3. Expected Results
The board opens correctly.

h3. Actual Results
The board fails with the following error:
!board_error.png|thumbnail!

{code}
Something's gone wrong
Our team has been informed. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
{code}

These errors appear in JavaScript Console in the browser:
{code}
react-dom.production.min.js:187 TypeError: Cannot read property 'trim' of undefined
    at sprint-selectors.js:31
    at index.js:76
    at index.js:36
    at index.js:90
    at index.js:36
    at Function.mapToProps (index.js:31)
    at i (wrapMapToProps.js:43)
    at Function.i.mapToProps (wrapMapToProps.js:52)
    at i (wrapMapToProps.js:43)
    at selectorFactory.js:26
qn @ react-dom.production.min.js:187
view.js:41 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'trim' of undefined
    at sprint-selectors.js:31
    at index.js:76
    at index.js:36
    at index.js:90
    at index.js:36
    at Function.mapToProps (index.js:31)
    at i (wrapMapToProps.js:43)
    at Function.i.mapToProps (wrapMapToProps.js:52)
    at i (wrapMapToProps.js:43)
    at selectorFactory.js:26
{code}

h3.Workaround
# Find the ID of the affect sprint (a sprint that was started in the Agility project with 'null' GOAL)
# Edit its GOAL to an empty string (or any other string) using REST API. An example using curl:
{code}
curl -D- -u <user>:<password> -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{
      "goal": ""
    }' https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/agile/1.0/sprint/<sprint ID>
{code}
#* *Be careful*: Use POST to perform a partial sprint update, DO NOT use PUT (full sprint update), which may update all other field to null causing irreversible sprint data loss
fields.summary: Board not showing when the Sprint is started through the mobile app

fields.description:
Currently, when editing/creating an issue, it seems if a user is part of two or more projects, when they use the drop-down box or "+" icon to link issues they can see all issues/epics from all projects. There should be some way to limit issue linking to the issues from within the current project.

 

Similar concern for "Epic Link" field.
fields.summary: Limit list of issues that are shown in "Linked Issues" drop down to current project

fields.description:
One of my end users got an error

 

"! Please input Component before you can move it into the next step.

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your Jira administrators."

This could have been much more clear, allowing the user to self correct instead of reaching out to me.

"! You must input a value in "Component" before you can move it into the next step.

It seems that you have tried to perform a workflow operation that is not permitted.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your Jira administrators."

or similar

not sure how full the logging is, could it even be

"! You must input a value in the "Component" field before you can move it into the next step.

It seems that you have tried to transition an issue which does not meet the required conditions for this workflow.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your Jira administrators."
fields.summary: Improve error messaging

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Reports at this time are available only for users that have access to the instance. In scenarios where you want to share the report with someone who doesn't have access to Jira, this person is not able to see the report with detailed information or charts.


h3. Notes
This will helps customers who use third-party tools, like Power BI, to export this report to Power BI and then share it with their customers without the need to provide access to Jira, etc.
fields.summary: Allow to get data from Burndown Chart Report via REST API

fields.description:
Kanban backlogs don't display the Estimation tab in Board settings and can't display the estimate "bubble" in the backlog.

The only workaround is to add it as a field in the Card layout tab, but then each issue has double rows just because of one number and everyone needs to know that the number is an estimate. Also, editing the estimate cannot be done easily from the backlog view, but must be done via the Edit dialog.
fields.summary: Add estimation to Kanban Backlogs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When perform a search in 'Active Sprints', if you navigate to 'Backlog' page and go back to 'Active Sprints', you still will be able to see the search results with no value in search field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an active sprint with some issues.
# In board's 'Active Sprints' page search for any keyword to get some results. You can search for a keyword that gives you no result.
# Without deleting the keyword from search field, navigate to 'Backlog' page.
# Without any action navigate back to 'Active Sprints' page.

h3. Expected Results
The 'Active Sprints' page has been refreshed and shows all issues with an empty search field.

h3. Actual Results
There's no value/keyword in search field, however the page still shows the search results.

h3. Workarounds
Refresh or reload the page.
fields.summary: Search results in 'Active Sprints' is not refreshed when navigate to 'Backlog'

fields.description:
SEN-11140184

Our Jira Service desk had intermittent slowness and timeout issues. Our IT looked into the issue and could not find the source, then the issue fixed itself.

Is there a way to see what the cause of the issues was?

Error that we received are:

*"Communication Breakdown" "The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation. Close this dialog and refresh your browser"* - This error occurred while the technician was idle in a request. 

*"Workflow Action Invalid" It seems that you have tried to perform a workflow operation (Start Progress) that is not valid for the current state of this issue (In Progress). The likely cause is that somebody has changed the issue recently, please look at the issue history for details. Please refresh the issue and try again"* - There was nothing in the history of the request that stood out, I also copied the workflow then deleted and re entered the transitions. After this the slowness when hitting a transition continued and the same error would occur intermittently between transitions. 

*"The Jira server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation."* - This would appear when we would try and load the workload report, it would take about 2mins for the browser to show the message. This issue is still occurring.
fields.summary: System slowness and timeout

fields.description:
h4. Current behaviour

Using the full issue details web interface, if a user does not have the schedule issues permission, they are not able to move issues between sprints. They are not able to edit the sprint field from the issue details screen or from anywhere else. This is the expected behaviour.

However, if I hit the REST endpoint authenticated as a user without the schedule issues permission for get issue (GET api/2/issue/\{issueId}?expand=editmeta), the sprint field comes down with the edit meta indicating that it is editable. On top of that, changing the sprint of an issue by editing the issue using the update issue endpoint (PUT api/2/issue/\{issueId}) returns successfully and changes the sprint when it shouldn't.
h4. Expected behaviour

The expected behaviour is that the sprint field does not come as part of the edit meta of an issue if the user doesn't have this permission, and also updating the sprint using the update issue rest endpoint should fail if the user doesn't have this permission.

This will make the official native Android and iOS apps, and the new issue view (as well as any other service that hits these endpoints) behave the same as the full view issue web interface.
h4. Impact

This impacts Jira Mobile (both iOS and Android native apps) as well as the new issue view from backlog/ boards, as well as any other service that uses the REST endpoints.
fields.summary: User without schedule issues permission is able to change sprint of an issue via edit issue REST endpoint

fields.description:
As a Jira Administrator/Manager, I would like to be able to see who created, changed, and deleted a Sprint or a Board in the audition log. Knowing that this kind of procedure may cause a huge loss to customers' companies. 

Logs for the changes made to the board filters permissions/shares also helps admins to identify, if the board is not accessible to some/all users due to filter permission issue.
fields.summary: Log actions to the audit log when changes or deletion are made on boards/sprints

fields.description: No matter the configuration set on Look and Feel for Date format, it will always been displayed as yyyy/MMM/dd on the new issue view
fields.summary: Bug on new issue view with due date format

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Burndown chart shows logged hours on the incorrect date if the work was logged on Tempo with a past start date.

h3. Environment
Jira Software Cloud with Tempo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log work on an issue (using Tempo) and set the 'Start Date' to a past date
# Generate a Burndown report

h3. Expected Results
The report should have an entry for the issue on the start date of the worklog.

h3. Actual Results
The report has an entry for the issue on one day before start date of the worklog.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
*
fields.summary: Burndown chart shows logged hours on the incorrect date

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The display of possible transitions in a board will break when having more than 3 status mapped to the same column in a board and a swimlane set to either Assignees or Stories 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test board
# Add 4 status on one of the columns
# Set the swimlane to Assignees
# Check the possible transitions for the issues under the first appearing assignee

h3. Expected Results

The transitions should be rendered fine.

h3. Actual Results

Part of the square indicating the transition is cut apart by the swimlane.
 !board_transition.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Change the Swimlanes approach.
fields.summary: Board transitions display bug when having more than 3 status in a column.

fields.description: It would be such a great feature if the epic and version panel is also available in the workmode. Not only at the backlog. In that case you can easily filter out issues on a certain epic or version. Instead of making quickfilters. (which is "limited in amount" )
fields.summary: make the epic/version panel available in the "workmode"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a given board, differently from the other quick filters, when you select an "Assignee" quick filter and refresh the page, the board shows all tickets, as if no quick filter was selected.

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira Software project (Kanban or SCRUM) and add issues on it
# Assign some of the tickets
# On the board view, select the filter *Unassigned* for example
# Refresh the page

h3. Expected Results
Board's view shows only tickets according to the "Assignee" quick filter selected

h3. Actual Results
The issues are displayed as if no quick filter was selected.

 [^Screen Recording 2018-06-25 at 04.03 PM.mov] 

h3. Notes


h3.Workaround

Create the quick filter in the board's settings. To do this, please follow the steps described below:

# On your board's view, click *more(...) > Board settings*
# On the left panel, click *Quick filter*
# Type the filter's name ("Unassigned", for example) in the *Name* field and type the JQL query under *JQL* field ("assignee is EMPTY", for unassigned issues)
# Click *Add*
fields.summary: Assignee quick filters are not kept after page refresh

fields.description:
STEPS:
 # Create a Bug and proceed with updating the description of recently created bug.
 # Try to attach a screenshot by pressing CTRL+V.

Actual Output:

Attach Screenshot pop-up appears on the screen. This pop-up is not scrollable. Hence I am not able to attach the screenshot to bug.  

!image-2018-06-25-18-47-46-918.png!
fields.summary: Attach screenshot pop-up window is not scroll-able while updating an existing bug summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the board uses a filter where JIRA is not able to define what projects are related to the board, and the user has *Manage Sprints*, *Browse Projects* and *Schedule Issues* permission on all projects of the instance, JIRA still does not allow the user to manage sprints (create, complete).

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with a filter that will relate more than one project
# The following message will appear on the board configuration: *The projects in this board cannot be listed because of the complexity of the board filter*
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-19 at 2.53.56 PM.png|thumbnail! 

# Create a new user without admin permission on the instance
# Add permissions on all projects to *Manage Sprints*, *Browse Projects* and *Schedule Issues*.
# Try to create, complete or do any managing operation on the related sprint/board

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to manage sprints with only those 3 permissions
h3. Actual Results
The user is not able to manage sprints and the following message is displayed:  
 !Screen Shot 2016-08-19 at 2.51.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
There are 2 workarounds available:

# Add the affected user to an administrator permission on the Jira Cloud site
# Specify the projects in the filter and grant manage sprints permission to the affected user
fields.summary: Users are not able manage sprints

fields.description:
I need an easy way to see if my parent issues are in progress or not at a glance.  

Many of us use sub tasks (or sub bugs) to break down tasks on a parent story or bug.   If one of the sub tasks (or sub bugs) is in progress I want greenhopper to change the status of the parent item to in progress.  It makes no sense for a sub-issue to be in progress (or resolved) and show the parent item as just "open".  If work is being done on one of the sub-issues, of course the parent item is in progress.  As a nice to have,  if all of the sub-issues are closed, then the parent should at least be "resolved".

Right now there seems to be no way to even indicate a story or bug with sub-issues is in progress.  The only way to do it is look at their sub-issues which is laborious.
fields.summary: If a sub-issue is in progress, the parent item should automatically move to 'In progress'

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When printing cards from a board, the size of the cards are different between Chrome and Firefox even when we choose the same card size.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a board in Chrome and Firefox.
# Click on *...* at the top right corner of the board > Print card.
# At the top left choose the same card size on both browsers.
# Print or save in PDF. 

h3. Expected Results
The card size should be the same for both browsers. 

h3. Actual Results
The same cards are printed in different sizes. 

The result on Chrome:
!chrome.png|thumbnail!

The result on Firefox:
!firefox.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Solution / Workaround
Use the same browser when printing cards.
fields.summary: Print card sizes are not the same.

fields.description:
When viewing the backlog, issues created as sub-task do not show up. It would be great to have a feature that allows the sub-task to be included in backlog view based on user preference. Something similar to the screenshot below

 !Subtasks in Backlog.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show Sub-task in Scrum backlog

fields.description:
Currently, the estimation criteria available on Jira boards are:

* Story Points
* Original Time Estimation
* Issue count
* Task progress

I would like to have "Remaining Time Estimate" as Estimation criteria
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to have "Remaining Time Estimate" as Estimation criteria

fields.description:
# Create an issue
 # Have an admin change a field from not required to required,(without notifying anyone ;)
 # Try to edit the description of the bug

=> if the bug is not configured to be shown in edit mode, there will be no indication that something is missing.

Suggestion: some indication that a particular required field is missing a value.
fields.summary: notification of missing required field when field is not confiured
in order to create an OAuth 2 link to JIRA, we need a client ID - but when we were configuring the API connections, it didn't ask for a client ID. So what's the client ID?

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Dragging the sprint footer doesn't work when the board filter is not ordered by rank. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the board settings.
# Change the board filter JQL to order by something different from rank. 
# Navigate to the board backlog and try to Drag the sprint footer. 

h3. Expected Results
You could select the issues by dragging down the sprint footer. Check this [GIF|https://cl.ly/3X1z1L0b1T1h] for a more visual content. 

h3. Actual Results
You can't move the sprint footer anymore. Check this [GIF|https://cl.ly/1X301y252t0I] for a more visual content.

h3.Solution / Workaround
Order by rank the Board or drag and drop the issues individually to the sprint.
fields.summary: Dragging the sprint footer doesn't work when the board filter is not ordered by rank.

fields.description:
A customer was confused by this error message showing on his board: "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue. Learn more" 

Apparently this displays if there are no projects or issue types detected, which is most likely due to the board's filter filtering them out.

The Learn more links to a general page on Configuring boards, but I think we should be more specific in the error message. Suggested text:
"You will need to use the full dialog to create a new issue, as your board's filter is excluding all projects and/or issue types."
fields.summary: Improve the "Due to the configuration for this particular board, you'll have to use the full dialog to create a new issue.Learn more" error message

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When dragging a card to the right, you can drag it beyond the right-most column to

h3. Environment
* Mac OS X
* Chrome - Version 67.0.3396.87 / Firefox - 60.0.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Scrum/Kanban board.
# Drag a card to the right.

h3. Expected Results
You could be able to drag it until you reach the right-most column. 

h3. Actual Results
[Check this GIF|https://cl.ly/0u440U0X3j3S]
fields.summary: 'Infinity' dragging cards on Scrum/Kanban boards.

fields.description:
Hello; 

We are using Jira cloud. 

1- I add a custom field that is additional assignee.  I want to use this field not only on web, I also want to use it in mobile application especially in IPAD's application not browser. 

 

2- I want to use my Jira cloud offline from mobile application.  This is very important to us.
fields.summary: IPAD JIRA program

fields.description:
It would be great to be notified if the sprint field has a value before moving an issue.
This causes a lot of confusion, since the consequences of moving an issue which already belongs to a sprint are not very intuitive for end-users:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-6850
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8168

My recommendation would be to display a warning during the move operation (i.e. *Move Issue: Update Fields* screen) such as the one below, and also to allow users to edit that field before moving the issue:
{panel:title=Warning}
(!) One or more issues belong to a sprint. Moving these issues will affect the boards which include them prior to and after the move operation. For more details, please refer to the article [Same sprint displayed across different scrum boards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Same+sprint+displayed+across+different+scrum+boards].
{panel}
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to be warned while moving issues which belong to a sprint

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a project manager, I would like to have a gadget which shows me the Sprints start and end date. 
h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a gadget where we can select the projects we want then the gadget will display those projects sprints and their start and end date. For example:
!image.png|thumbnail!
(screenshot was taken from [All-In-One Reports for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212942/all-in-one-reports-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview])
h3. Workaround
Use a third-party add-on such as [All-In-One Reports for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212942/all-in-one-reports-for-jira?hosting=cloud&tab=overview].
fields.summary: Create a gadget to show all the projects' Sprints start and end date

fields.description:
h3. Issue description

Smart commit not working when having an agent with a customer SD account and an user account with same email. The smart commit is sent but Jira doesn't recognise it to trigger the operation requested. Only a comment is added.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create an user with an email on Jira
 # Add a customer SD with the same email
 # Go to bitbucket and perform a smart commit
 # It will not trigger the status change, but will show that a commit has been performed under development tool

h3. Expected results

Issue should process the smart commit performed even if the Jira user has a customer SD account with the same email.
h3. Actual results

The smart commit is sent but Jira doesn't recognise it to trigger the operation requested. Only a comment is added.
h3. Workaround

Request to site-admin or organisation admin to remove the customer SD account or change it email.
fields.summary: Smart commit not working when having an agent with a customer SD account and an user account with same email.

fields.description:
On the instructions for changing [Card Colors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html#Customizingcards-coloursConfiguringcardcolors], step 3 should be:
Click (...) > Board settings and go to Card colors
fields.summary: doc missing a step

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint can't be found in _Create Issue Screen_ if it's created in board where user doesn't have access to.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Have a project and Scrum board 
#* Make sure both project and board are accessible for any logged in user
#* Also, make sure to add Sprint field in Create Issue screen.
# Create another Scrum board and make sure to set the board's filter to private (only the owner can access it.
# Create some issues, a Sprint  start it in the *private* board
# Login as other user who doesn't have access to private board.
# Go to Issue Navigator > Create a new issue (Create Issue screen pop up)
# In Sprint field, key in the Sprint name to find the newly created (and started) Sprint.

h3. Actual Results

No Sprint suggestion return (No matches)

h3. Expected Result

The Sprint should show up in the list of Sprint suggestion.

h3. Workaround

Access the other board (non-private board) to see the Active Sprint. Then, go back to attempt to create a new issue, the Sprint should show up.
fields.summary: Sprint can't be found if it's created in board where user doesn't have access to

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When performing a search in a board that contains closed (collapsed) swimlanes, one has to click *>* for each swimlane in order to expand it and check for results in that specific swimlane. This can become counter-productive when there are many swimlanes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have Jira automatically expand all the swimlanes that contain issues matching the search criteria. Keep other swimlanes (that do not contain issues matching the search criteria) collapsed.

h3. Workaround
At this moment there is no known workaround. One has to manually expand all the collapsed swimlanes to check for search results
fields.summary: expand closed swimlanes when performing a search

fields.description:
I have a few Jira issues that have a status "Deployed" that were accidentally set.

 

The previous workflow had no outgoing or ingoing transitions for this status.

 

When I tried to add one, I would get this error.

  !image-2018-06-18-08-06-05-111.png!

Is there a major techincal reason why one cannot add a transition to statuses such as this?
fields.summary: Workflow Statuses
Create user api sometimes returns error saying the user does not exists. and same input runs sometimes

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When any language other than Englich (US/UK) is set in user's profile page, user is unable to start an sprint in Agility project and gets the following error message:
{code}
Something's gone wrong
An error occurred on our end. Refresh the page and try again.
{code}

h3. Notes
* Tested for Italian, Japanese, Russian and French.
* Only Agility projects are affected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility project.
# Enable 'Backlog' and 'Sprint' features in the Agility project.
# Create a new sprint in backlog.
# Add some issues to the sprint.
# Click on 'Start Sprint' button.
#* Start sprint dialog appears where sprint's 'Start date' and 'End date' are not auto-filled. These fields will be auto-filled if you choose English language.
# Select 'Start date' and 'End date', and click on 'Start' button. 

h3. Expected Results
Sprint starts.

h3. Actual Results
Sprint is not being started and following error message appears:
{code}
Something's gone wrong
An error occurred on our end. Refresh the page and try again.
{code}
 !Agility Project - Start Sprint - Error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workarounds
* Choose English (US/UK) language in your profile.
* Create a non-Agility software project, and move the issue to the new project (e.g CSV Import)
fields.summary: Unable to start sprint in agility project when the profile language is not set as English

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
With the new feature that enable fast switch through the boards on the instance, it's causing some confusions because it's showing historical boards and not only the boards related to the project.
 !image-2018-06-14-17-39-38-092.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution
Give an option to display only the boards related to the project instead of showing all the boards that has been accessed on the instance.
h3. Why this is important
Customers are complaining about the confusion or miss configuration on their instances that is causing to show all the boards under board list on the project due the new feature. Customers are complaining that boards are not related to the project but appearing to be because of the new view.
h3. Workaround 
None available, [contact support|https://support.atlassian.com/] for further assistance.
fields.summary: On board switch option list only board related to the project

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to load the Epic Completion statistics from within an Atlassian Connect app as they are only provided by the Jira Software Private API which is not whitelisted.

These statistics are very taxing to calculate using the REST API due to the number of issues which can be involved.

The statistics provide valuable top-level information for our users as to Epic completion and is one of our top-requested features for Easy Agile User Story Maps and Easy Agile Roadmaps for Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Expose the Epic Statistics to Atlassian Connect Addons

fields.description:
*Summary*
When you navigate to a Kanban board > Settings > Card colours and click in the link "Learn more about card colors.", the user is directed to a broken link, it goes to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Customising+Cards instead of https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html

*Steps to reproduce*
1. Navigate to a Kanban board
2. Go to the Board settings
3. Go to Card colors
4. Click the link "Learn more about card colors".

*Expected Results*
Go to the page [Customizing cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html]

*Actual Results*
it's a broken link: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Customising+Cards
fields.summary: Broken link - Kanban board settings

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * Given a project with a Kanban board
 * Create 2 tickets with fixVersion 1.0, one with fixVersion 1.1
 * Move one of them to Done.
 * In Kanban board, select "Release" and select fixVersion 1.0.
 * Jira warns about non-completed issues and recommends opening ReleaseHub.
 * Dialog offers "Ignore and proceed with Release" or "Move issues to version"

Expected behavior when selecting "Ignore and proceed..": Only Done tickets with fixVersion 1.0 are released

Observed behavior: All tickets with fixVersion 1.0 are released from board.

Expected behavior when selecting "Move issues to version": Tickets that are done will be released as 1.0. The other tickets will be moved to the new version.

Observed behavior: All tickets whether done or not will be moved to the new version.

 

Note: I think this is a bug or at least usability issue - however, my user account is not permitted to report bugs.
fields.summary: UX issue/bug when releasing from a Kanban board
Burndown chart for inactive sprints

fields.description:
Allow instance admins to control which users should have access to an add-on. This would be very useful to restrict some add-on's abilities just to some specific users, given by the instance admin

The current configuration is that all users have access to the add-on's functionalities, and are billed accordingly.
fields.summary: Allow admin to limit add-on licenses to specific users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we right-click the tickets on the backlog of software project boards, the menu is sometimes displayed at the top of the page, instead of where you clicked it. It happens only in the new interface.

When testing, we could see that the menu appears in the position defined in the style attribute 'top' of an HTML element with ID 'gh-ctx-menu-trigger_drop'. This is defined in pixels and this number decreases as the number of sprints and issues increases progressively, but almost invisibly for each new sprint or issue, but adds up as this number increases. 

So, this bug is not reproducible on boards with only a few issues and sprints, but large backlogs, the 'top' element may even have a negative value, meaning it will show above the browser window, invisible to the user.

Also, the menu position is dependant on the position of the card on the board. The closest to the top the card is, the higher up the menu will appear, so if you right-click cards on the top, it's more likely that it will be hidden on the top of the screen.

h3. Environment
Cloud - Jira d94605f9

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a board with many issues and sprints
# Try to right-click on a ticket in the backlog of a software board.

h3. Expected Results
Right-click menu should be displayed where you click

h3. Actual Results
The menu is displayed at the top of the page.
 
h3. Notes

We carried out some tests that clearly showed that the menu starts going up as the number of sprints increased. In all these tests, the only issue in the backlog was right-clicked:
# This is a board with a single issue and no sprints:
!no_sprints.png|thumbnail!
# This has 7 sprints (still 1 issue), the 'top' style attribute is at '419px' here:
!7_sprints.png|thumbnail!
# Here, the board has 12 sprints (1 issue), the 'top' style attribute is at '272px'. We can see it's going up, it's not even aligned with the issue we clicked (the only one in the screenshot)
!12_sprints.png|thumbnail!
# With 20 sprints, it's almost reaching the top of the page, the 'top' attribute is at '53px':
!20_sprints.png|thumbnail!

It may seem a long way to reach the top, but adding tickets also affects this behavior. Here is the same board still with 20 sprints, but with 15 tickets spread across the board, instead of 1:
!20_sprints_15_issues.png|thumbnail!

In this case, 'top' attribute is already '23px'.

h3.Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
Use drag and drop if you want to move to a different sprint

h4. Workaround 2
# Open your browsers JavaScript Console:
#* https://webmasters.stackexchange.com/questions/8525/how-do-i-open-the-javascript-console-in-different-browsers
# Right-click the card
#* *Make sure not to click anything else in the browser*
# Run this in JS Console:
{code}
document.querySelector("#gh-ctx-menu-trigger_drop").style.top = "500px"
{code}

Here's a video showing workaround 2:
[^JRACLOUD-67978.mp4]
fields.summary: Board List Menu Misplaced Upon Right-Click

fields.description:
In a kanban on-boarding dialog, it says, "The new Kanban backlog gives *your* a bigger space to plan work for your team."

It should say, "The new Kanban backlog gives you a bigger space to plan work for your team."

So the first _your_ is changed to _you_.
fields.summary: Typo in kanban backlog on-boarding dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues, attempting to navigate to pages until it displays 1001+ (usually page 21 and above) will result in the issue navigator freezing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that the JIRA instance has more than 1000 issues.
# Go to the issue navigator and run a JQL that returns more than 1000 issues.
# Navigate the pages until it will display issues *1001-xxxx of xxxx* where xxxx is the total number of issues in the projects. This is usually on page 21 or above by default.

h3. Expected Results
The Issue navigator will return issues 1001 and so on in the page.

h3. Actual Results
The issue navigator will be stuck loading but nothing will load at all. 
The rest of the JIRA UI will still be responsive. 

h3. Notes
Based on the KB: [How to increase the JIRA search results limit on the issue navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-increase-the-jira-search-results-limit-on-the-issue-navigator-357696242.html?_ga=2.50945505.991592081.1497249977-589427334.1480340499], JIRA is supposed to show a message prompt to refine the search but based on testings with vanilla JIRA 7 instances, the message prompts do not appear and the user can proceed to click on pages for issues 1001+.
fields.summary: When attempting to access more than 1000+ results in List view, the issue navigator will be frozen
JIRA error when creating an issue in Agility board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* It is not possible to integrate Jira with Bitbucket Cloud
* Installed integrations not working properly (not showing dev panel, DVCS page showing the error 'Error when refreshing account xxxx').

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud
* Bitbucket Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Try reinstall the integration

h3. Expected Results
It should integrate properly.

h3. Actual Results
{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
The add-on failed to be installed: Error calling uninstalled at URL https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall: 401 Client Error: Unauthorized for url: https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall
{code}

OR

{code}
Failed to display BB Connection approval screen due to Bitbucket indicating an error in Jira redirect. Error: server_error. Error description: Error calling installed at URL https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/install: 403 Client Error: for url: https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/install
{code}

h3. Notes
* Errors
{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
Failed to display BB Connection approval screen due to Bitbucket indicating an error in Jira redirect. Error: server_error. Error description: Error calling uninstalled at URL https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall: 401 Client Error: Unauthorized for url: https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/aci/1.0/installation/jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin/uninstall
{code}
* Similar https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67985

h3. Workaround
Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/].
fields.summary: Unable to integrate Jira with Bitbucket - 401 or 403 error thrown

fields.description:
I would love the slack integration for Jira Cloud to include a "/jira snooze" function. This would stop notifications for a given period of time. This would be very useful while mass updating tickets or doing sprint planning/retrospective. We want the notifications, but they are not useful when we know that we are updating a lot of tickets at once.

 

I didn't see a separate place for suggesting features specific to the slack integration. Please point me to the right place if there is a better place to post this suggestion.

 

Also, being able to set a time in the command would be great:
 * /jira snooze for 1hr
 * /jira snooze until 5:00pm
fields.summary: Slack integration snooze feature

fields.description:
If a Confluence space is archived, the link to that space in the Jira Pages screen should remain - maybe with a message to say that the space has been archived. We want this feature because it helps us find legacy information quickly.

Direct links to pages from issues remain even when a space is archived, so the functionality should exist. Right now, if a space is archived, the Jira Pages screen displays this error:
h3. Well, this is awkward...
We can't show you these pages. Please try again later.
fields.summary: Keep Jira Pages link to archived Confluence spaces

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Move to done feature does not work when having a screen associated with the closure transition and the New Jira Issue view enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a software project
# Edit the workflow and associate a screen with the "Done" status
# Create a Story with a sub-task and add them to an active Sprint
# Transition the sub-task to Done 
# Try to use the *Move to done* button in the Story 

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should present the respective screen and allow the user to enter the values for each field.

h3. Actual Results

The screen is presented but no field is editable.
For some reason, the resolution field still works fine.

Video showing the current behavior:
 [^resolve_screen.mp4] 

h3. Notes

This can especially affect workflows that have conditions for fields.
For example, if there's a condition for the fix version to not be empty and it should be set in the closure screen the user won't be able to close the issue on the board.

h3.Workaround

Disable the New issue view under in the user profile under the Labs section.
Transition the issue directly in the issue view.
fields.summary: Move to done while having screen associated with the respective transition and the New Jira Issue View enabled will make the screen fields un-editable.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce in a kanban board:
# Assign several issues to a version. 
# Release this version
# Go to the project's report menu and select "Version Workload Report"
# Select the version in question and click on "Next"

h3. Expected Results:
The tasks that are currently assigned to the version in question are displayed in the report.

h3. Actual results:
No issues appear.
fields.summary: Version Workload Report not working in Kanban boards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The issue detail view of the backlog of a board will load blank if you access the board with a pre-selected issue which is no longer present in the backlog.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum or Kanban board
# Create a test issue
# Either transition the issue out of the backlog statuses or close the active Sprint where it apepars
# Try to access the board with the pre-selected issue, e.g:
{noformat}
https://{instance}/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=25&projectKey={key}&view=planning&selectedIssue={issuekey}
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The backlog load normally without showing the issue since it's no longer there and all the sequent actions should work fine.

h3. Actual Results

The backlog loads normally without showing the issue which is expected but the next issue you try to view the details will load them blank:
 !detailbug.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes

Reproducible with both the new issue detail view and old.

h3.Workaround

Just click on another issue and the details should get back to normal.
fields.summary: Issue detail in backlog loads blank

fields.description:
I am using Jira Cloud.

The page is [https://***SPACENAME***.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks|https://%2A%2A%2Aspacename%2A%2A%2A.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/applinks/listApplicationLinks]

Nothing happens when I insert a link on the form and click on the "Create new link", but I get the following JS errors:  !image-2018-06-06-16-32-05-397.png!

It's a permission error, please show a clear error message because I lost an hour of work.
fields.summary: Unable to create an Application Link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, Sprint Report will show issues added to sprint after start date with "*" symbol beside the Issue Key.

However, information of who added it and when it was added are not shown in the Sprint Report. There is no JQL to find it either, as these information is part of Issue's "History" and not put inside a field.

h3. Suggested Solution

For issues added to sprint after start date, show the date it was added and who did it in Sprint Report

h3. Why this is important
 
It helps users to see in the report about who made a Scope Change, and when it was made
fields.summary: For issues added to sprint after start date, show the date it was added and who did it in Sprint Report

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In epic page (issue view page), if you click on "Create issue in epic" button to add a new issue to this epic, you'll be able to choose issue type 'Epic' for the new issue. If you select the issue type 'Epic' and choose "Create", just a new epic will be created. 
 However, this causes the confusion that user is adding an epic to the current epic!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an epic
 # Access the epic page (issue view screen)
 # Click on "Create issue in epic" icon ( *+* ). Create issue screen will be appeared with the title: *Create issue in epic :* <issue-key>

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to choose any issue type except 'Epic' for the new issue which is being created in the current epic.
h3. Actual Results

In issue type field you'll be able to see and chose 'Epic'
h3. Note

If you create an epic within another epic (following steps above), a new epic will be created which is not linked to the current epic.
fields.summary: User is able to choose issue type 'Epic' while creating issues in an epic!
Provide a public REST API endpoint to get development info associated with an issue

fields.description:
*Summary*
When in the backlog, and using a quick filter for labels, creating an issue (option at the end of the backlog) will create the label automatically only in lower case.

It will convert any uppercase letters anywhere in the original label to lowercase:
Test => test
tesT => test
Test-Thing => test-thing

*Environment*

*Steps to Reproduce*
# access a Scrum project
# create a label with a name starting with capital letter (for example, Test)
# go to the backlog
# access the board setting and create a quick filter for 'Test'
# go to the backlog and select the quick filter 'Test'
# go back to the board and, at the end of the backlog, use the option to create an issue


*Expected Results*
The issue will be created with the label 'Test'

*Actual Results*
The issue is created with the label set in small letters (test)

*Workaround*
Delete the label that appears in the create screen and the option with capital letter will appear in the drop-down list
fields.summary: When in the backlog, and using a quick filter for labels, creating an issue will create the label automatically only in lowercase

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Drop-down filters get blurry when zooming out.

h3. Environment

Any backlog drop-down list on Chrome - Version 65.0.3325.181 (Official Build) (64-bit).

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to a board backlog view;
# Zoom out the browser to 80%;
# Open the assignee drop-down;
# It gets blurry.

h3. Expected results

The assignee drop-down should be normal.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-09 at 15.24.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The drop-down gets blurry while zooming out about 80%.
 !Screen Shot 2018-04-09 at 15.18.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Drop-down filters get blurry when zooming out

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We are seeing a disagreement in scope totals and scope remaining calculations between:
 * _/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/releaseburndownchart?rapidViewId=##&versionId=##_ (which is used to draw the Release Burndown chart) and
 * _/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapid/charts/versionreport?rapidViewId=##&versionId=##_ (which is used to display the issue tables on the same chart)

The *versionreport endpoint* and the *release burndown table* display only issues that are _currently_ assigned to the target version. Whereas the *release* burndown endpoint and chart will consider any issues that _were assigned to the version_ on the period represented in the report.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software CLoud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a version
 # Create two issues
 # Estimate both issues
 # Start a sprint with the issues, transition them to done and close the sprint
 # Remove one of the issues from the version

h3. Expected Results

The Release Burndown report sums the estimation for issues *currently on version* when calculating complete/incomplete totals.
h3. Actual Results

The Release Burndown report sums the estimation for *all issues that were in the version* when calculating complete/incomplete totals, despite only rendering the issues currently on the version on the table.
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Release burndown is inconsistent with its table and version report handling issues removed from the version

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cascading custom field is not displaying the correct information on card layout at the board.
When user set a cascading custom field and assign the field to an issue and set it's value, on the board the custom field is retrieving the first value after the option none from the dropdown list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a *select list (cascading)* and assign to the screens.
# Add the dropdown values
# Create an issue and set the values for the custom field
# Go to the settings of the board and enable to show the *custom field* created on the card layout.
# Check the card layout on the board, it's not showing the values selected on the issue.
# The first value is correct, the second value is always the first value from the dropdown list

Check the video below where it shows the discrepancie information form the issue view and card layout.

[Reproducing the bug|https://cl.ly/3Y3W140Y2z1L]

h3. Expected Results
Card layout on the board should show the same information for the *select list (cascading)* custom field that is shown on the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The first value is correct, the second value is always the first value from the dropdown list

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround as the information displayed on the card layout is not editable.
fields.summary: Cascading custom field is not displaying the correct information on card layout at the board.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you have a board where the _swimlanes_ is based on _Stories_, the only issues you will have beneath _Stories_ are _Sub-tasks_ (in most cases). Knowing that this issue type doesn't have the *Epic Link* field, the *Show/hide epic labels* button have no utility on that scenario, instead, it might cause so confusion, leading the user to think that it's a bug.
 
h3. Suggested Solutions
Either create a pop up to inform that in that scenario the button will not provide that information or disable the button.
fields.summary: Disable 'Show epic labels' when the Swimlanes is based on Stories.
Random issue if e.g. assign user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to sort the issues in a board by Days in column.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a feature to sort issues in a board by Days in column.
fields.summary: Ability to sort issues in boards by the Days in column field.

fields.description:
Sub-tasks should be shown on the epic swimlanes if the parent issue is hidden by a quick filter.
Use case:
# Assign parent issues to an epic.
# Create sub-task on a parent issues.
# Add parent issue to an active sprint
# Configure scrum board for epic swimlanes
# Add quick filter that hides the parent issues but does not hide the sub-task.
# Go to work mode and apply the quick filter from step 5.

Result: sub-task is displayed on a swimlane "Issues without an epic"
Expected result: sub-task must be shown on the epic swimlane from the parent issue. The Epic swimlane remains visible after applying the quick filter.
fields.summary: Display sub-task under an epic swimlane if a parent issue is hidden.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While setting the start & end date of a sprint, the datetime picker UI still shows in 12hrs format (AM/PM). Even though the date format has been changed to 24hrs in Jira settings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Settings > System > General Configuration, select Advanced Settings
 # Change the date Time range picker format to 24h format using this documentation:
 ** [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira063/how-to-change-the-date-time-range-picker-format-to-24h-format-683542334.html]
 # Go to Scrum board and create sprint and add any issue to the sprint
 # Click the start sprint option and look at the time in the date/time picker UI, it is still in the 12hr format instead of the 24hr format

h3. Expected Results

The datetime UI to show the time in 24hr format


 !expected_date picker.PNG!
h3. Actual Results

The datetime UI is shows the time in 12hr format


 !current_date picker.PNG!

 
h3. Notes
The issue only exist when changing the start/end date of a sprint. Everywhere else does not show a similar issue.
fields.summary: Sprint date picker UI does not show the correct time format

fields.description:
Request to create an API that will push issues from JIRA to workfront

Suggestion:

At the moment, there is an add-on from Workfront that lets us create issues in Jira (when it is created in Workfront) and updates the issue in w/f when the issue is updated in Jira and vice versa. 

However, we would like the ability to post issues in workfront when they are created in Jira. Pushing issues should be based on a custom field in JIRA. 

This will be a great add-on for us and I suppose many others who use Workfront for Project management and Jira for Product management.

Thanks,

Neha
fields.summary: Request to create an API that will push issues from JIRA to workfront

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The icons/images for the SLA fields on Agile board cards do not display.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk Project
 # Create a Kanban Board of that same project
 # Add a Card with "Time to Resolution" field from the "Card Layout" Board configuration

h3. Expected Results

SLA image and colour is displayed along with the data as it does on Service Desk or in a JIRA Issue Search.
 !Atlassian_Cloud_-_Atlassian_Support_System.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

Board shows only a number without the image
 !BOARD_SCC_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Bug existed before in JSWSERVER-12449: Service Desk SLA images missing on Boards
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: SLA images missing on Agile Boards cards

fields.description:
There are two types of bulk changes I will generally need to make in my usage of JIRA. The first type is a one-off change, generally due to some sort of structural change in our project management workflow; it is this type of change that the Bulk Edit feature seems to be best designed for.

 

However, (due to quirks in our own specific workflows or internal PM styles), there are some bulk edits that I find the need to repeat every month or so. Allow a user to "save" a bulk edit operation and repeat the same operation again later. I.e. if I want to find all issues of a certain status and transition them to another status, I should be able to save that operation as some sort of "macro" that I could then easily repeat later with just one or two clicks.
fields.summary: Allow users to save and repeat bulk changes via macros

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the user's Username has a diacritic sign (for example: ł) the Agility Board will not work properly:
- the page isn't rendered correctly
- it is not possible to transition issues (changes are not saved)
- clicking on an issue will not pop up the issue's details

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Agility Project. Then, create one issue in the board.
# Change your username to "Atłassian Test User" (notice the diacritic sign)
# Go to the Agility Board.

h3. Expected Results
The board will be rendered correctly.
 !agility1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The board will not be rendered correctly, and multiple actions are not working.
 !agility2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This is caused by the diacritic sign not being handled correctly. This can be seen through the console error:
{code}
GET /rest/api/2/user?username=At?assian%20Test%20User
statusCode: 404 

{"errorMessages":["The user named 'At?assian Test User' does not exist"],"errors":{}}
{code}

h3. Workaround
Rename the user's Username in User Management, and remove the diacritic sign.
fields.summary: Agility Board does not work if the user's Username has a diacritic sign

fields.description:
Please update all references of 'JIRA' to 'Jira' per the new branding: https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/our-bold-new-brand

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update JIRA to Jira

fields.description:
Users that have the "Administer Jira" Project permissions have the ability to add new status  even if they do not have the "Administer Jira" global permission. They can create the new statuses by going to the board settings and using the "Add new Status" button from there. This effectively bypasses the permissions that would prevent them from creating a new status in the first place.

This can represent a small security issue in that it does not allow the site-admins enough granularity to prevent project owners from creating a great many different statuses in the global space.

I would like to propose that the permissions be made more clear and more granular such that you can prevent users from adding new statuses without having proper permissions, but can otherwise manage the project settings.
fields.summary: Allow restriction of creating new status for Jira Software Project Admins

fields.description:
Problem Definition
Currently, to get the overview list of all sprint of a Jira project, it can be achieved by using REST API
{code}
https://yourjira.com/rest/greenhopper/1.0/integration/teamcalendars/sprint/list?jql=project+%3D+YOURPROJECTKEY 
{code}

Suggested Solution
It will be a great feature to allow users to list overview of all sprint in a Jira project by clicking a button.

Workaround
Currently, user needs to run a REST API to get the list of overview of all sprint inside a project
fields.summary: Getting an overview list of all sprint of a JIRA project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When performing transitional smart commit, comment were supposed to be added as per the following documentation:
 * [Processing issues with Smart Commits - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/processing-issues-with-smart-commits-788960027.html/]
 
||Description||Example||Notes||
|Transitions a Jira Software issue to a particular workflow state.|ABC-90 #close Fixed this today|This example executes the close issue workflow transition for the issue and adds the comment '{{Fixed this today}}' to the issue. Note that the comment is added automatically without needing to use the #{{comment }}command.|
 
h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# # Perform a smart commit using the following format:
#* ||Example|ABC-90 #close Fixed this today|

h3. Expected Results

ABC-90 should be moved to "Close" status, and "Fixed this today" is added as comment
h3. Actual Results

ABC-90 were moved to "Close" status, but "Fixed this today" was not added as comment
h3. Workaround

To add comment, add #comment in the commit message as well. For example:
{quote}
ABC-90 #close #comment Fixed this today
{quote}
fields.summary: Comment not added when transitioning using smart commit

fields.description: I need obtain a general report customize that define time  tracking of all projects in my tool.
fields.summary: How to creare a customize report in JIRA  of all projects

fields.description:
We have a Jira server installation and use a custom workflow where tasks are rolled up to epics which in turn roll up to features or bugs which in turn roll up to Change Requests.

 

When closing a task within a epic I got the error message below:

 

org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:ChangeGroup][issue,25791][author,agranados][created,2018-05-25 11:57:25.532][id,146988] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO public.changegroup (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, CREATED) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?) (FEHLER: aktuelle Transaktion wurde abgebrochen, Befehle werden bis zum Ende der Transaktion ignoriert))

 

Strangely enough I created a new task within the same epic and I got the same error message.

Eventually I updated the epic link and was able to close the task and the original epic without problems and transitioned the parent feature to the next status.
fields.summary: JIRA error message when closing tasks in custom wokflow

fields.description:
Forgot to include music to the dancing screen.  Next time I will.  

 

Checkout the dancing screen shot during editing an issue - [https://www.useloom.com/share/8f9ee99ea8474f54895fad27063e3f87]

 

very irritating when this happens.  

Magesh
fields.summary: dancing screen when issue edit

fields.description:
Hi,

I am currently trialling the Jira Software product for implementation in to a Data Analysis tea and also an Engineering team.

I have used Jira Software before in a Software team.

The functionality of Jira Software is amazing and has all features required for implementation into the teams I am looking for HOWEVER my suggestion is:-

Can you please make the words displayed possible to change for example I would like to use the word "WORKSCOPE" instead of "SPRINT" and "MILESTONE" instead of "VERSION".

These simple changes without changing any functionality would make it much simpler to implement into non software teams.

Thanks

Andrew Haines
fields.summary: Change Names on screens such as SPRINT and VERSIOn

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When changing the *Epic Name* of a *Epic* it is not refreshing the name at *Active Sprint* board for a *Scrum project board* only

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic
# Create an *Epic Name*
# Assign an issue to the epic and assign to a sprint and start the sprint
# Go to *Active Sprints* board
# Check the *Epic Name* of the issue
# Go back to Epic and change it *Epic Name*
# Go back to the board and refresh it, you'll see that the board will not refresh the *Epic Name*

Reproducing on video the bug: https://cl.ly/0M0W2k2Q2q2s

h3. Expected Results
After changing the *Epic Name* it should refresh on the Active Sprints board like it works on Kanban Board

h3. Actual Results
*Epic Name* still reflects the old value

h3.Solution / Workaround
Access the Board Settings and go back to the board, it will force the values displayed on the board.
fields.summary: Changing the Epic Name of a Epic it is not refreshing the name at Active Sprint board

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently integration with Github or Bitbucket requires too many permission. 

!BB_confirm_access.png|thumbnail!

As security is a pretty sensitive topic of late, it will be better to give clarifications on why certain permissions are required for the integration.  

For example, if 'Read and Write to your account information' is not required then it should not request users for it. If it's required, a simple explanation on why it is needed will give more clarity on its usage.
fields.summary: DVCS integration permission review

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If user profile language is set to Swedish, starting a sprint with _Start Date_ and _End Date_ picked with the date picker will throw an error like _Incorrect date format_
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Switch user profile language to Swedish 
2. Create a new sprint in a project
3. Start the sprint with the start date and end date
4. Edit the dates by clicking a date from the pop-up calendar
h3. Expected Results

With the dates selected from the date picker, sprint can be started
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown that the _Start Date_ and _End Date_ are in the wrong format
h3. Workaround

Change user language to English
fields.summary: Error data format when start sprint with language Swedish

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using agility boards with sprints enabled, issues in done status will get cleared off the boards after 14 days although the sprint is not completed.

h3. Expected Results
- If Agility or Agility + backlog, then clearing the board is automatic, and should happen is resolved date is > 14 day
- If sprints are enabled, the clearing should only happen when the sprint is finished, and automatic clearing of the board should be disabled.

h3. Actual Results
- The issues get cleared off even when sprint is not yet completed

h3.Workaround  
N/A
fields.summary: With sprints enabled, issues with Done status gets cleared off after 14 days in agility board

fields.description:
We run a Kanban board which is sourced from multiple projects (that each also have their own boards), and as such need a fairly rich state flow. Having columns for each state takes up a lot of screen real estate when some columns are very rarely used.

I would like for there to be an option to only display a column (or as compromise make the default width of the column much more narrow) when there are no tickets in that status. These states are driven by other boards and as such whilst I realise we would lose the ease of dragging on our board, it isn't something we ever use - at least not for those status.
fields.summary: Option to hide columns when no tickets in that status
BatchUpdateException on inserting a repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In workflow or automation triggers - Branch Created event, it doesn't support the user mapping. Thus, it will not respond to Post Functions or automation actions with the 'Current User' or "Use who triggered the event" function:


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow user mapping for 'Branch Created' event
h3. Why this is important

Triggers are designed for the automated process. Without user mapping, the purpose is partially fulfilled.
fields.summary: Allow User Mapping for 'Branch Created' Trigger, in both workflow post functions and Jira automation

fields.description:
h3. Epic should follow its child issues status. 
i.e. We have *Epic_1* with 2 child issues (*issueA* and *issueB*), in case one of the issues move to *IN PROGRESS*, Epic should automatically move to that Status too and when both issues are marked as *DONE*, Epic status should be *DONE* too.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create automation on Jira to implement this procedure.
fields.summary: Epic status should follow its child issues status.
